p:
Previous studies concerning polyphenols quantification in Plectranthus spp. plants have established that P. ecklonii aqueous extracts obtained from microwave extraction had one of the highest contents on compound ( 17)
34 . This study helps to understand the high collagenase activity observed for the P. ecklonii aqueous extract since many polyphenolic compounds, such as catechin and EGCG, have been reported to inhibit collagenase
40 , probably by acting as metal chelators, making the Zn 2+ ion unavailable for catalytic activity
19
,
40 .
